trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Dixon
There were no other sightings in Dixon on or around April 30th 1965
Summary: Huge red flame slow moving horizontal flying fireball.
divs: Sighting DetailsWhen I was seven years of age, a "Giant" red fireball was observed late one night while lying in bed looking out the window at the stars above (most likely in the Summer of 1965) near Dixon, Missouri. The hugh red fireball appeared to be much larger than our house and I thought that it was just barely over tree top level. It traveled very slow for a metorite (maybe the speed of a small plane flying over, or slower). The fireball was covered with and trailing red flames as it flew slowly by horizontal to the ground and not making a noise. Expecting a nearby crash from this giant ball of fire, I covered my head with my pillow awaiting the impact that never came. The next day I heard on the radio that a large metorite was seen falling in the area the night before and a search was underway to locate it. I never heard another word about it. Been watching the skies for many years now, and have never seen a anything flying across the sky this large, low, or slow covered with red flames of fire.
